name: Portfolio
shortDescription: Created this personal portfolio website to showcase my projects and skills. Built with React and TypeScript to ensure a clean, maintainable, and scalable structure. The main goal was to intensify my React skills and experiment with different approaches to component design, state management, and UI architecture.
description: A personal portfolio built using React and TypeScript
html: I implemented dynamic components, smooth animations, and reusable sections to create a flexible and performant user experience. Additionally, I experimented with different layout and styling approaches, incorporated responsive design techniques, and ensured accessibility best practices throughout the site.

name: SauNah
description: A personal portfolio built using React and TypeScript
shortDescription: Developed a booking website for sauna rentals as part of our bachelorâ€™s degree project. Worked in a team divided into frontend and backend, where I was responsible for backend development. My work focused on implementing core features like user registration, authentication, booking management, image handling, and overall system stability.
html:
The backend was built with Java Spring Boot, using PostgreSQL as the main database and Flyway for version-controlled database migrations. The backend exposed RESTful APIs consumed by the frontend, ensuring secure user authentication, data integrity, and smooth integration of business logic.

My Responsibilities

I focused on the backend development, including implementing core business logic, authentication, data persistence, and error handling. My main contributions included:

  • User Management:
    • Implemented customer registration and login (including admin support).
    • Handled special character compatibility in passwords to improve security and user experience.
    • Added error handling and validation for authentication flows.
  • Sauna Management:
    • Developed and adjusted sauna endpoints and properties to match the evolving frontend needs.
    • Refactored sauna entity fields (e.g., converting price to float type).
    • Integrated image storage and object storage handling for sauna listings.
  • Booking System:
    • Implemented the booking feature, including logic for reservation creation and validation.
    • Integrated Google Calendar synchronization and fixed duplication issues during booking confirmation.
  • Error Handling and API Stability:
    • Introduced consistent error messages across all API endpoints.
    • Resolved server errors related to invalid tokens on unprotected routes.
    • Improved exception handling and standardized API responses.
  • Database and Infrastructure:
    • Created and maintained database migration scripts using Flyway.
    • Ensured data consistency and proper schema evolution during development.
  • Project Finalization:
    • Cleaned up backend warnings, improved stability, and refined code quality during the final project phase.
